TopicTitle: Orbital Carbon Observatory 2 (OCO-2) | KSP Stock Craft

Articles.Content:
So i've seen that Squad posted on his Facebook page a recreation of OCO-2 in KSP made with mod, so i've decided to make a Stock version ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/Rn5tV)

> 
> Not bad.

Thanks! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

If someone want i can post the .craft file

> 
> What was the launcher?

A random one, i was thinking of making a Delta II to carry it into orbit, what do you think about?
Will it fit in a cargobay?

> 
> Will it fit in a cargobay?

I've just tried, it fit in both Mk2 and Mk3 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> I've just tried, it fit in both Mk2 and Mk3 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Oooh, I wonder if this would make for an STS compatible subassembly then... ?

> 
> Oooh, I wonder if this would make for an STS compatible subassembly then... ?

Yes! I would be very pleased if you do this ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Here the craft file: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/5uu631a21qq6wp9/OCO2.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/5uu631a21qq6wp9/OCO2.craft?dl=0)
I'm thinking for the arms instead of actually using the cube struts,off-set the solar panels and then attach a strut to them.

> 
> I'm thinking for the arms instead of actually using the cube struts,off-set the solar panels and then attach a strut to them.

I've tried but the only problem is that the base of solar panel is huge near the strut :/

> 
> Yes! I would be very pleased if you do this ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> Here the craft file: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/5uu631a21qq6wp9/OCO2.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/5uu631a21qq6wp9/OCO2.craft?dl=0)

Great! Post it in the STS thread so I don't forget!
